channel.title: The Hangover
channel.description:
[size=18pt][b]This is based on the movie.[/b][/size]
Alright so I can up with this idea the other day.
You start out going to a party at a bar, you have a few drinks and then the bar tinder drugs you. Then one of your friends goes missing... You must now go looking for him all around the RuneScape world! As you talk to more people you will find clues on where he is at.
I will be thinking more on this.
Please post some feed back on this : D

item.title: The Hangover
item.dc:creator: @south-park south-park
item.description:
@south-park wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:12, topic:490603”][quote author=Lin link=topic=608836.msg4231716#msg4231716 date=1361316566]

Just terrible.
[/quote][quote author=imthenull link=topic=608836.msg4231710#msg4231710 date=1361315579]
Wow, this topic is either a troll or the OP is an idiot.
[/quote]I wish people like you two would leave the community. You guys are great examples of why private servers and this community as a whole are failing. When someone tries something, you shoot them down. Go hate somewhere else.

I think this is a fun idea for a quest, but you should make it mandatory to complete each step along the way so someone who has completed it can’t just skip to where your friend is at.

A movie made in 2009 and a MMO game based in the medieval times, yeah those two pair up perfectly. The general idea/point of this post is completely useless, and it’s strikingly similar to clue scrolls (apart from the fact you’re looking for a friend rather than treasure).

Nonetheless, how is giving my opinion on a topic make “private servers and this community as a whole” fail. Oh that’s right, because people with stupid ideas like this are twelve and can’t handle it when someone post negative content about them, their project, or their ideas. They’re too immature to handle what people think, I believe this is why you pointed us out too.[/quote]
I’m not 12 Oo

Read full topic

A movie made in 2009 and a MMO game based in the medieval times, yeah those two pair up perfectly. The general idea/point of this post is completely useless, and it’s strikingly similar to clue scrolls (apart from the fact you’re looking for a friend rather than treasure).

Nonetheless, how is giving my opinion on a topic make “private servers and this community as a whole” fail. Oh that’s right, because people with stupid ideas like this are twelve and can’t handle it when someone post negative content about them, their project, or their ideas. I was going to base a server off a movie that’s main currency was time. It’s that movie with the time on the person’s arm and they always had to get more time by killing people or selling what they owned or whatever.
